trans-unit.source: Analyze data from servers in Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze data from servers in Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Search event and IIS logs for cloud services and virtual machines by enabling Azure diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: Search event and IIS logs for cloud services and virtual machines by enabling Azure diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: Analyze data from servers in Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Analyze data from servers in Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights uses data from servers in your on-premises or cloud infrastructure.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights uses data from servers in your on-premises or cloud infrastructure.

trans-unit.source: You can collect machine data from Azure storage when generated by Azure diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: You can collect machine data from Azure storage when generated by Azure diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: Using the data you collect from Azure storage, you can quickly search event and IIS logs for cloud services and virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Using the data you collect from Azure storage, you can quickly search event and IIS logs for cloud services and virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: You can also get additional insights from your virtual machines by installing the Microsoft Monitoring Agent.
trans-unit.target: You can also get additional insights from your virtual machines by installing the Microsoft Monitoring Agent.

trans-unit.source: The Update Assessment, Change Tracking, and SQL Assessment solutions all work with the Microsoft Monitoring Agent to provide deeper insights on your virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The Update Assessment, Change Tracking, and SQL Assessment solutions all work with the Microsoft Monitoring Agent to provide deeper insights on your virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: If you haven’t already, you can [add solutions](operational-insights-setup-workspace.md) when you’re signed into the [Operational Insights portal](https://www.microsoft.com/oms/).
trans-unit.target: If you haven’t already, you can [add solutions](operational-insights-setup-workspace.md) when you’re signed into the [Operational Insights portal](https://www.microsoft.com/oms/).

trans-unit.source: For Azure virtual machines, there are two easy ways to enable agent-based data collection:
trans-unit.target: For Azure virtual machines, there are two easy ways to enable agent-based data collection:

trans-unit.source: In the Microsoft Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: In the Microsoft Azure management portal

trans-unit.source: Using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: When using agent-based collection for log data, you must configure which logs to collect in the Log Management configuration page of the [Operational Insights portal](https://www.microsoft.com/oms/).
trans-unit.target: When using agent-based collection for log data, you must configure which logs to collect in the Log Management configuration page of the [Operational Insights portal](https://www.microsoft.com/oms/).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you’ve configured Operational Insights to index log data using Azure diagnostics and you configure the agent to collect logs, then the same logs will be indexed twice.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you’ve configured Operational Insights to index log data using Azure diagnostics and you configure the agent to collect logs, then the same logs will be indexed twice.

trans-unit.source: You will be charged normal data rates for both data sources.
trans-unit.target: You will be charged normal data rates for both data sources.

trans-unit.source: If you have the agent installed, then you should collect log data using the agent and not index the logs collected by Azure diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: If you have the agent installed, then you should collect log data using the agent and not index the logs collected by Azure diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: You can install the agent for Operational Insights from the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/#Workspaces/OperationalInsightExtension/Workspaces).
trans-unit.target: You can install the agent for Operational Insights from the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/#Workspaces/OperationalInsightExtension/Workspaces).

trans-unit.source: To install the agent for Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: To install the agent for Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, go to your Operational Insights workspace and select the **Servers** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, go to your Operational Insights workspace and select the **Servers** tab.

trans-unit.source: On the tab, you’ll see a list of your virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: On the tab, you’ll see a list of your virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machine you want to install the agent on and then click **Enable Op Insights**.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machine you want to install the agent on and then click **Enable Op Insights**.

trans-unit.source: The agent is automatically installed and configured for your Operational Insights workspace.
trans-unit.target: The agent is automatically installed and configured for your Operational Insights workspace.

trans-unit.source: Image of Operational Insights Servers page
trans-unit.target: Image of Operational Insights Servers page

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The [Azure VM agent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn832621.aspx) must be installed to automatically install the agent for Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The [Azure VM agent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn832621.aspx) must be installed to automatically install the agent for Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: PowerShell
trans-unit.target: PowerShell

trans-unit.source: If you prefer scripting to make changes to your Azure virtual machines, then you can enable the Microsoft Monitoring Agent using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: If you prefer scripting to make changes to your Azure virtual machines, then you can enable the Microsoft Monitoring Agent using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Monitoring Agent is an [Azure virtual machine extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn832621.aspx) and you can manage it using PowerShell, as shown in the example below.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Monitoring Agent is an [Azure virtual machine extension](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn832621.aspx) and you can manage it using PowerShell, as shown in the example below.

trans-unit.source: When configuring using PowerShell, you need to provide the Workspace ID and Primary Key.
trans-unit.target: When configuring using PowerShell, you need to provide the Workspace ID and Primary Key.

trans-unit.source: You can find your Workspace ID and Primary Key on the **Settings** page of the Operational Insights portal.
trans-unit.target: You can find your Workspace ID and Primary Key on the **Settings** page of the Operational Insights portal.

trans-unit.source: sources
trans-unit.target: sources

trans-unit.source: Collect data using Azure diagnostics
trans-unit.target: Collect data using Azure diagnostics

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights can analyze data written to Azure storage by Azure diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights can analyze data written to Azure storage by Azure diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: There are 2 main steps to perform:
trans-unit.target: There are 2 main steps to perform:

trans-unit.source: Configure the collection of diagnostic data to Azure storage
trans-unit.target: Configure the collection of diagnostic data to Azure storage

trans-unit.source: Configure Operational Insights to analyze data in the storage account
trans-unit.target: Configure Operational Insights to analyze data in the storage account

trans-unit.source: The topics below describe how to enable collection of diagnostics data to Azure storage and then how to configure Operational Insights to analyze the data in Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: The topics below describe how to enable collection of diagnostics data to Azure storage and then how to configure Operational Insights to analyze the data in Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: Azure Diagnostics is an Azure extensions that enables you to collect diagnostic data from a worker role, web role, or virtual machine running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure Diagnostics is an Azure extensions that enables you to collect diagnostic data from a worker role, web role, or virtual machine running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: The data is stored in an Azure storage account and can then be used by Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: The data is stored in an Azure storage account and can then be used by Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You'll be charged normal data rates for storage and transactions when you send diagnostics to a storage account and for when Operational Insights reads the data from your storage account.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You'll be charged normal data rates for storage and transactions when you send diagnostics to a storage account and for when Operational Insights reads the data from your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Azure Diagnostics can collect the following types of telemetry:
trans-unit.target: Azure Diagnostics can collect the following types of telemetry:

trans-unit.source: Data Source
trans-unit.target: Data Source

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: IIS Logs
trans-unit.target: IIS Logs

trans-unit.source: Information about IIS web sites.
trans-unit.target: Information about IIS web sites.

trans-unit.source: Azure Diagnostic infrastructure logs
trans-unit.target: Azure Diagnostic infrastructure logs

trans-unit.source: Information about Diagnostics itself.
trans-unit.target: Information about Diagnostics itself.

trans-unit.source: IIS Failed Request logs
trans-unit.target: IIS Failed Request logs

trans-unit.source: Information about failed requests to an IIS site or application.
trans-unit.target: Information about failed requests to an IIS site or application.

trans-unit.source: Windows Event logs
trans-unit.target: Windows Event logs

trans-unit.source: Information sent to the Windows event logging system.
trans-unit.target: Information sent to the Windows event logging system.

trans-unit.source: Performance counters
trans-unit.target: Performance counters

trans-unit.source: Operating System and custom performance counters.
trans-unit.target: Operating System and custom performance counters.

trans-unit.source: Crash dumps
trans-unit.target: Crash dumps

trans-unit.source: Information about the state of the process in the event of an application crash.
trans-unit.target: Information about the state of the process in the event of an application crash.

trans-unit.source: Custom error logs
trans-unit.target: Custom error logs

trans-unit.source: Logs created by your application or service.
trans-unit.target: Logs created by your application or service.

trans-unit.source: NET EventSource
trans-unit.target: NET EventSource

trans-unit.source: Events generated by your code using the .NET [EventSource class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.diagnostics.tracing.eventsource(v=vs.110).aspx)
trans-unit.target: Events generated by your code using the .NET [EventSource class](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/system.diagnostics.tracing.eventsource(v=vs.110).aspx)

trans-unit.source: Manifest based ETW
trans-unit.target: Manifest based ETW

trans-unit.source: ETW events generated by any process
trans-unit.target: ETW events generated by any process

trans-unit.source: Syslog
trans-unit.target: Syslog

trans-unit.source: Events sent to the Syslog or Rsyslog daemons
trans-unit.target: Events sent to the Syslog or Rsyslog daemons

trans-unit.source: Currently, Operational Insights is able to analyze:
trans-unit.target: Currently, Operational Insights is able to analyze:

trans-unit.source: IIS logs from Web roles and virtual machines
trans-unit.target: IIS logs from Web roles and virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Windows Event logs from Web roles, Worker roles and Azure virtual machines running a Windows operating system
trans-unit.target: Windows Event logs from Web roles, Worker roles and Azure virtual machines running a Windows operating system

trans-unit.source: Syslog from Azure virtual machines running a Linux operating system
trans-unit.target: Syslog from Azure virtual machines running a Linux operating system

trans-unit.source: The logs must be in the following locations:
trans-unit.target: The logs must be in the following locations:

trans-unit.source: WADWindowsEventLogsTable (Table Storage) – Contains information from Windows Event logs.
trans-unit.target: WADWindowsEventLogsTable (Table Storage) – Contains information from Windows Event logs.

trans-unit.source: wad-iis-logfiles (Blob Storage) – Contains information about IIS logs.
trans-unit.target: wad-iis-logfiles (Blob Storage) – Contains information about IIS logs.

trans-unit.source: LinuxsyslogVer2v0 (Table Storage) – Contains Linux syslog events.
trans-unit.target: LinuxsyslogVer2v0 (Table Storage) – Contains Linux syslog events.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] IIS logs from Azure Websites are not currently supported.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] IIS logs from Azure Websites are not currently supported.

trans-unit.source: For virtual machines, you also have the option of installing the [Microsoft Monitoring Agent](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=517269) into your virtual machine to enable additional insights.
trans-unit.target: For virtual machines, you also have the option of installing the [Microsoft Monitoring Agent](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=517269) into your virtual machine to enable additional insights.

trans-unit.source: In addition to being able to analyze IIS logs and Event Logs you will also allow be able to perform additional analysis including configuration change tracking, SQL assessment and update assessment.
trans-unit.target: In addition to being able to analyze IIS logs and Event Logs you will also allow be able to perform additional analysis including configuration change tracking, SQL assessment and update assessment.

trans-unit.source: You can help us prioritize additional logs for Operational Insights to analyze by voting on our [feedback page](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/267889-azure-operational-insights/category/88086-log-management-and-log-collection-policy).
trans-unit.target: You can help us prioritize additional logs for Operational Insights to analyze by voting on our [feedback page](http://feedback.azure.com/forums/267889-azure-operational-insights/category/88086-log-management-and-log-collection-policy).

trans-unit.source: Enable Azure diagnostics in a Web role for IIS log and event collection
trans-unit.target: Enable Azure diagnostics in a Web role for IIS log and event collection

trans-unit.source: Refer to [How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Refer to [How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx).

trans-unit.source: You’ll use the basic information from there and customize the steps here for use with Microsoft Azure Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: You’ll use the basic information from there and customize the steps here for use with Microsoft Azure Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: With Azure diagnostics enabled:
trans-unit.target: With Azure diagnostics enabled:

trans-unit.source: IIS logs are stored by default, with log data transferred at the scheduledTransferPeriod transfer interval.
trans-unit.target: IIS logs are stored by default, with log data transferred at the scheduledTransferPeriod transfer interval.

trans-unit.source: Windows Event Logs are not transferred by default.
trans-unit.target: Windows Event Logs are not transferred by default.

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostics
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostics

trans-unit.source: To enable Windows Event Logs, or to change the scheduledTransferPeriod, configure Azure Diagnostics using the XML configuration file (diagnostics.wadcfg), as shown in [Step 2: Add the diagnostics.wadcfg file to your Visual Studio solution](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step2) and [Step 3: Configure diagnostics for your application](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step3) in the How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service topic.The following example configuration file collects IIS Logs and all Events from the Application and System logs:
trans-unit.target: To enable Windows Event Logs, or to change the scheduledTransferPeriod, configure Azure Diagnostics using the XML configuration file (diagnostics.wadcfg), as shown in [Step 2: Add the diagnostics.wadcfg file to your Visual Studio solution](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step2) and [Step 3: Configure diagnostics for your application](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step3) in the How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service topic.The following example configuration file collects IIS Logs and all Events from the Application and System logs:

trans-unit.source: In [Step 4: Configure storage of your diagnostics data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step4) of the How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service topic, ensure that your ConfigurationSettings specifies a storage account, as in the following example:
trans-unit.target: In [Step 4: Configure storage of your diagnostics data](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn482131.aspx#BKMK_step4) of the How To Enable Diagnostics in a Cloud Service topic, ensure that your ConfigurationSettings specifies a storage account, as in the following example:

trans-unit.source: The **AccountName** and **AccountKey** values are found in the Microsoft Azure Management Portal in the storage account dashboard, under Manage Access Keys.
trans-unit.target: The **AccountName** and **AccountKey** values are found in the Microsoft Azure Management Portal in the storage account dashboard, under Manage Access Keys.

trans-unit.source: The protocol for the connection string must be **https**.
trans-unit.target: The protocol for the connection string must be **https**.

trans-unit.source: Once the updated diagnostic configuration is applied to your cloud service and it is writing diagnostics to Azure Storage, then you are ready to configure Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: Once the updated diagnostic configuration is applied to your cloud service and it is writing diagnostics to Azure Storage, then you are ready to configure Operational Insights.

trans-unit.source: Enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine for event log and IIS log collection
trans-unit.target: Enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine for event log and IIS log collection

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine for Event Log and IIS log collection using the Microsoft Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine for Event Log and IIS log collection using the Microsoft Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine with the Azure management portal
trans-unit.target: To enable Azure diagnostics in a virtual machine with the Azure management portal

trans-unit.source: Install the VM Agent when you create a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Install the VM Agent when you create a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine already exists, verify that the VM Agent is already installed.
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine already exists, verify that the VM Agent is already installed.

trans-unit.source: If you use the default Azure management portal to create the virtual machine, perform a **Custom Create** and select **Install the VM Agent**.
trans-unit.target: If you use the default Azure management portal to create the virtual machine, perform a **Custom Create** and select **Install the VM Agent**.

trans-unit.source: If you use the new Azure management portal to create a virtual machine, select **Optional Configuration**, then **Diagnostics** and set **Status** to **On**.
trans-unit.target: If you use the new Azure management portal to create a virtual machine, select **Optional Configuration**, then **Diagnostics** and set **Status** to **On**.

trans-unit.source: Upon completion, the VM will automatically have the Azure Diagnostics extension installed and running which will be responsible for collecting your diagnostics data.
trans-unit.target: Upon completion, the VM will automatically have the Azure Diagnostics extension installed and running which will be responsible for collecting your diagnostics data.

trans-unit.source: Enable monitoring and configure event logging on an existing VM.
trans-unit.target: Enable monitoring and configure event logging on an existing VM.

trans-unit.source: You can enable diagnostics at the VM level.
trans-unit.target: You can enable diagnostics at the VM level.

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostics and then configure event logging, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostics and then configure event logging, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Select the VM.
trans-unit.target: Select the VM.

trans-unit.source: Click **Monitoring**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Monitoring**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Diagnostics**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Diagnostics**.

trans-unit.source: Set the **Status** to **ON**.
trans-unit.target: Set the **Status** to **ON**.

trans-unit.source: Select each diagnostics metric that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select each diagnostics metric that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: Operational Insights can analyze Windows event system logs, Windows event application logs and IIS logs.
trans-unit.target: Operational Insights can analyze Windows event system logs, Windows event application logs and IIS logs.

trans-unit.source: Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure PowerShell you can more precisely specify the events that are written to Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure PowerShell you can more precisely specify the events that are written to Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Refer to the Azure Diagnostics 1.2 Configuration Schema for a sample configuration file and detailed documentation on its schema.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the Azure Diagnostics 1.2 Configuration Schema for a sample configuration file and detailed documentation on its schema.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you install and configure Azure PowerShell version 0.8.7 or later from [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure).
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you install and configure Azure PowerShell version 0.8.7 or later from [How to install and configure Azure PowerShell](powershell-install-configure).

trans-unit.source: If you have a version of Microsoft Azure Diagnostics installed that is earlier than version 1.2 you cannot use the new portal to enable or configure diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: If you have a version of Microsoft Azure Diagnostics installed that is earlier than version 1.2 you cannot use the new portal to enable or configure diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: You can enable and update the Agent using the following PowerShell script.
trans-unit.target: You can enable and update the Agent using the following PowerShell script.

trans-unit.source: You can also use this script with custom logging configuration.
trans-unit.target: You can also use this script with custom logging configuration.

trans-unit.source: You will need to modify the script to set the storage account, service name and virtual machine name.
trans-unit.target: You will need to modify the script to set the storage account, service name and virtual machine name.

trans-unit.source: To enable diagnostics in a virtual machine with Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To enable diagnostics in a virtual machine with Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Review the following script sample, copy it, modify it as needed, save the sample as a PowerShell script file, and then run the script.
trans-unit.target: Review the following script sample, copy it, modify it as needed, save the sample as a PowerShell script file, and then run the script.

trans-unit.source: Enable Azure Storage analysis by Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: Enable Azure Storage analysis by Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to enable storage analysis and configure Operational Insights to read from the Azure Storage account with Azure Diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to enable storage analysis and configure Operational Insights to read from the Azure Storage account with Azure Diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: To enable analysis by Operational Insights
trans-unit.target: To enable analysis by Operational Insights

trans-unit.source: In the default Azure portal, navigate to your Operational Insights workspace and select the **Storage** tab.
trans-unit.target: In the default Azure portal, navigate to your Operational Insights workspace and select the **Storage** tab.

trans-unit.source: ![workspace storage tab](./media/operational-insights-analyze-data-azure/workspace-storage-tab.png)
trans-unit.target: ![workspace storage tab](./media/operational-insights-analyze-data-azure/workspace-storage-tab.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Add a Storage Account** to open the **Add Storage Account** box.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add a Storage Account** to open the **Add Storage Account** box.

trans-unit.source: Select the storage account that you want to use.
trans-unit.target: Select the storage account that you want to use.

trans-unit.source: In the **Data Type** list, select a data type: either **Events**, **IIS Logs** or **Syslog (Linux)**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Data Type** list, select a data type: either **Events**, **IIS Logs** or **Syslog (Linux)**.

trans-unit.source: Click the **OK** image.
trans-unit.target: Click the **OK** image.

trans-unit.source: ![storage account box](./media/operational-insights-analyze-data-azure/storage-account.png)
trans-unit.target: ![storage account box](./media/operational-insights-analyze-data-azure/storage-account.png)

trans-unit.source: Repeat the above steps for each data type and storage account combination that you want to collect.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the above steps for each data type and storage account combination that you want to collect.

trans-unit.source: In approximately 1 hour you will begin to see data from the storage account available for analysis within Operational Insights.
trans-unit.target: In approximately 1 hour you will begin to see data from the storage account available for analysis within Operational Insights.

trans-unit.target: Related content

trans-unit.target: Connect computers directly to Operational Insights

trans-unit.target: Blog post: Enable Operational Insights for Azure Virtual machines
